test-case.name: import-schema-164
test-case.description: Test that a namespaced attribute with a schema-defined default value is properly inserted into the source document, with a namespace declaration if necessary. Note, the rules here are clearly defined in XSD 1.1 (see 3.4.5.1 Attribute Default Value, namespace fixup). But they are not clearly defined in XSD 1.0.

test-case.name: import-schema-165
test-case.description: Test that generating an invalid attribute can cause failure of the transformation even if the attribute is not actually written to the result tree, because of the presence of another attribute with the same name (erratum E10)

any-of.assert-xml: <s:out xmlns:s="http://schema070.uri/" validation="strict" s:tob="05:15:00" pling="05:15:00" plong="05:15:00" plang="05:15:00" s:dob="1951-10-11"/>

test-case.name: import-schema-166
test-case.description: Simple test of xsl:import-schema with @namespace and @schema-location.Verify that top-level element and attribute declarations and defined types that are in @namespace are available for use in the stylesheet.

test-case.name: import-schema-167
test-case.description: Test where a schema is imported in an imported stylesheet but datatypes are used in the primary stylesheet.

test-case.name: import-schema-168
test-case.description: Test where a schema is imported in the primary stylesheet but datatypes are used in an imported stylesheet.

test-case.name: import-schema-169
test-case.description: Test where a schema is imported in the primary stylesheet but datatypes are used in an included stylesheet.

test-case.name: import-schema-170
test-case.description: Test where a schema is imported in the primary stylesheet but datatypes are used in a stylesheet that is imported by an included stylesheet.

test-case.name: import-schema-171
test-case.description: Test where a schema is imported in an included stylesheet but datatypes are used in the primary stylesheet.

test-case.name: import-schema-172
test-case.description: Test where a schema is imported in an imported stylesheet of an included stylesheet but datatypes are used in the primary stylesheet.

test-case.name: import-schema-173
test-case.description: Test for importing one and the same schema several times. Whichever comes second should be ignored, no error should be raised for component conflicts.

test-case.name: import-schema-174
test-case.description: Test where the same schema is imported in both the primary and the included stylesheet. Whichever comes second should be ignored, no error should be raised for component conflicts. Datatypes are used in the primary stylesheet.

test-case.name: import-schema-175
test-case.description: Test of xsl:import-schema with @namespace and @schema-location importing a more complex schema. Verify that top-level element and attribute declarations and defined types that are in @namespace are available for use in the stylesheet.

test-case.name: import-schema-176
test-case.description: Test with xsl:import-schema without @namespace to show that top-level element and attribute declarations and defined types that are in no namespace are available for use in the stylesheet.@schema-location is present.

test-case.name: import-schema-177
test-case.description: Test for importing two different schemas with the same @namespace but different import precedence. Cases tested: - elements, attributes or types with the same names but different properties exist in the two schemas - elements, attributes or types with different names exist in the two schemas.

test-case.name: import-schema-178
test-case.description: Test with xsl:import-schema where no schema is found for the namespace specified. No components are used from this namespace.

test-case.name: import-schema-179
test-case.description: Simple test of inline schema for a user defined simple type that is used as the type of a variable in the stylesheet. Example from Spec.

test-case.name: import-schema-180
test-case.description: Test with xsl:import-schema without @namespace which contains an xs:schema element with @targetNamespace. Verify that elements defined in the targetNamespace from the imported schema are available for use in the stylesheet.

test-case.name: import-schema-181
test-case.description: Test with xsl:import-schema without @namespace which contains an xs:schema element without @targetNamespace. Verify that elements in no namespace from the imported schema are available for use in the stylesheet.

test-case.name: import-schema-182
test-case.description: Test with typical purchase order schema with simple and complex types.

test-case.name: import-schema-183
test-case.description: Test of xsl:import-schema without attributes and with empty content. Do not use any non-built-in data types to prevent error since GrammarPool is empty by default.

test-case.name: import-schema-184
test-case.description: Test with xsl:import-schema where @namespace is present but @schema-location is omitted. Do not use any non-built-in data types to prevent error since GrammarPool is empty by default.

test-case.name: import-schema-185a
test-case.description: Test for importing several schemas with different @namespace and @schema-location. No xs:schema content.

test-case.name: import-schema-185b
test-case.description: Test for importing several schemas with different @namespace and @schema-location. No xs:schema content.

test-case.name: import-schema-185c
test-case.description: Test for importing several schemas with different @namespace and @schema-location. No xs:schema content.

test-case.name: import-schema-186
test-case.description: Test where two different schemas with different namespaces are imported, one in the primary and one in the imported stylesheet. Show that datatypes from both schemas can be used in both stylesheets.

test-case.name: import-schema-187
test-case.description: Test where two different schemas are imported, one in the primary and one in the included stylesheet. Show that datatypes from both schemas can be used in both stylesheets.

test-case.name: import-schema-188
test-case.description: Test with inline schema importing another schema. The imported declarations are not used in the stylesheet.

test-case.name: import-schema-189
test-case.description: Test to show that importing a schema implicitly imports other schemas that are referenced from that schema using xs:include.

test-case.name: import-schema-190
test-case.description: Test to show that importing a schema implicitly imports other schemas that are referenced from that schema using xs:redefine.

test-case.name: import-schema-191
test-case.description: Test that an error is raised if the processor is set to Basic Processor and the stylesheet includes an xsl:import-schema.
